short_summary: SPTS - 5.15 Intermediate Technical Clerk and Junior Technical Clerk Services
description: The contract requires for the grant of one (1) 5.15 Intermediate Technical Clerk and one (1) 5.15 Junior Technical Clerk for Directorate of Maritime Management and Support (Management Information System) (DMMS (MIS)) and the Navy to manage its technical and material-identification data.
full_summary:
**Tender Title:**
TSPS 5.15 Intermediate Technical Clerk and Junior Technical Clerk Services for Directorate of Maritime Management and Support (Management Information System) (DMMS (MIS))

**Reference Number:** [Note: This field was empty in the contractor's original entry. However, it is required for a proper tender announcement. Please fill in the correct reference number. For example, if the source is a website, the reference number could be the URL of the page.]

**Amendment Number:** 4
**Solicitation Number:** W8482-231301/B
**Publication Date:** 2023-10-13
**Tender Closing Date:** 2023-11-15 14:00:00

**Request for Proposal (RFP) Details:**
This requirement is for the provision of technical services to the Department of National Defence. The services required include one (1) intermediate technical clerk and one (1) junior technical clerk for the Directorate of Maritime Management and Support (Management Information System) (DMMS (MIS)) and the Navy. The services will involve managing technical and material-identification data.

**Security Requirements:**
Company Minimum Security Level Required: SECRET
Resource Minimum Security Level Required: SECRET
Document Safeguarding Security Level Required: None

**Associated Documents:**
A comprehensive tender package is available for eligible bidders who hold a Supply Arrangement under E60ZT-18TSPS. The package includes detailed specifications, terms and conditions, and evaluation criteria. Requested materials will be e-mailed directly from the Contracting Authority to the eligible bidders.

**Technical Details:**
The requirement is open only to Tier 1 ($0 - $3.75M) qualified supply arrangement holders.

**Contract Period and Level of Effort:**
The proposed contract period is from the contract date to 31 March 2025. The estimated level of effort for the initial contract period will be 320 days per resource. For the option periods, the estimated level of effort will be 240 days per resource, per year.

**Trade Agreements:**
Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CC
